description:
Apium graveolens, commonly known as celery, is a plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial, herbaceous plant that is widely cultivated for its edible stalks, leaves, and seeds.

Celery plants typically grow to a height of 30-60 cm, with hollow, ridged stems that are green or pale green in color. The leaves are compound, pinnately divided, and have a distinctive, slightly bitter and aromatic flavor. The flowers are small, white, and arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family.

Celery is known for its high water content, as well as its rich source of various vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, including vitamins A, C, and K, potassium, and folate. It has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits, such as reducing inflammation, improving digestion, and supporting cardiovascular health.

Celery is widely used as a culinary ingredient, adding flavor and crunch to a variety of dishes, from soups and salads to stir-fries and juices. It is also a popular vegetable in many cuisines around the world.
prompt: Provide a short scientific description of this species: Apium graveolens
